alert.note: Alert for Northern Big Horn; Southwestern Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 5:31PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL BIG HORN AND SOUTH CENTRAL YELLOWSTONE COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM MDT... At 530 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 18 miles southeast of Lockwood, or 22 miles southeast of Billings, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Crow Indian Reservation. This advisory does not include the city of Billings. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
